zDT_JI6evj4ahrK34zswxg.text: Our family eats out at Chinese on a regular basis. This restaurant was nothing over the to, but definitely better than the other reviews would lead you to believe.  The aromatic duck was slightly overlooked but tasted great.  The pork was cooked perfectly and the dry fried green beans were outstanding. Great garlic mix and a nice spice to them.  Everything had a terrific flavour that was enjoyable.  I would return to this location again.

7qNLjFbGLeu2PT_0ksIskA.text: The environment is good for a restaurant but very thing is expensive. I ordered a house fried noodle, it was okay but salty. The portion is tiny and expensive and I paid 12 for the little dish of noodle. I rather try other Chinese restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of China Star - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. House fried noodle

fJHVfl4hUjZeWJ2vRsQ3ug.text: DO NOT EAT HERE!!!  The food is horrible and tasteless. I had vegitarian spring rolls that were clearly taken out of a freezer bag thrown in a fryer and burned.   I then had the chicken with cashews. There was absolutely no flavor, seasoning or substance to this dish. It was so bland.   I followed with a "fresh and light raspberry cheesecake perfect for after a meal." It came out frozen with freezer burn on it. When I smacked it with my spoon the lady yells to me "you have to wait a little bit." It was solid as a rock. Just horrible.   All this experience of bad food cost me 25. I recommend trying some place else. There IS good food in Edinburgh, you just have to find it!

qJaVM_Rxndf0FSs8kY31kA.text: Two words: Not impressed! I thought I stop by and get my take away dinner on a spontaneous note.  The place appeared empty at arrival. Sometimes people are going in and out, so I thought I give it a try. As usual, I ordered my HOT and SOUR soup and some Beef Chow Mein.  There are more choices on the menu of course, but this is what makes me happy, or so I thought :-)  The prices are high, the soup contained too much pepper, the Chow Mein was bland, not really that friendly a welcome (well, happy to see me of course to buy something - No wonder, I felt so used!)   the place decor very boring (whilst I waited I had a good look around)..... Well, do I need to say more?

cwXhttw9zO8Vs5r4xv6WVA.text: I have always had a nice meal here. I am not a fan of their chicken satay, too much pineapple for my liking but I enjoy the Singapore Fried Rice, Roast Duck in spicy chilli sauce, Chicken Curry,  Lar Chee Lamb and  the Pork Char Siu with Szechuan Sauce. Their dumplings rival Chop Chop. I especially like the way they cook the fried rice very light and fluffy and not greasy like some places. The staff are friendly and courteous and will have a joke with you if you are a relaxed diner. The manager knows her regulars well and chats and jokes with them.

seGmoU-So5KwiWuK4-gW0w.text: Great food, service, atmosphere...I had the corn and chicken soup..it was wonderful.  Try the scallops with black bean sauce....Being chinese food snobs from New York we were stunned to find such great chinese food in Scotland.

6gTe0qwtJsL8lgCJRFS1hg.text: Plenty of much better places in the haymarket area. A mainly take-away restaurant with small eating area. Food nothing special. I accidently broke a glass and they charged me 8 for it. Most I've spent on a glass in my life! Don't go here if you are as clumsy as me :)
